name: Dream Warrior
description:
In the future, the world is controlled by corporations rather than governments, and wars are fought in a dream world rather than in reality. The corporations can control dream demons to defeat their foes, but resistance fighters still defy them. The player is one of these resistance fighters hoping to rescue some friends from the control of Ocular, the mightiest of all dream demons.

Gameplay is somewhat reminiscent of Xenophobe, with the player moving through side-scrolling, space-station-like environments shooting at an endless onslaught of strange creatures. By making good use of power-ups and gaining access to new levels, the player can eventually find Ocular, which can only be defeated if all six of its eyes are shot closed.
alsoFor: Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, DOS | Combined View

releases.comments: covermount Your Sinclair, issue 45 (September, 1989), in "Smash Tape 21", Side A

shot.caption: This screen displays as the game loads
The main screen in glorious flashing scrolling technicolour
The start of the game. Unusual action keys. Z/X are left & right, L/; are forwards & backwards
It is possible to stay in the start of game location for a long time and be untouched by all the nasties that float past
Eventually the player has to come out of the alcove and start shooting stuff
A force field blocks the way to the right. The blob like things on the floor can be picked up when walked on.
The way to the left is also blocked, better find what this LIFT message means then
When the sleep energy has depleted the game ends and the player, if they're lucky, gets to enter a high score
The Hi-Score table is also a flashing technicolour job
